words.definition: Admission is the act of allowing to enter a place.
words.example: The admission ticket to the movie was $5.

words.definition: Astronomy is the study of the stars and planets.
words.example: Harold decided to study astronomy because he loved watching the stars.

words.definition: To blame someone for something bad is to say they did it.
words.example: My mom blamed me for something I didn’t do.

words.definition: Chemistry is the study of and reaction to substances.
words.example: In chemistry class, we learned about chemical reactions.

words.definition: If something happens despite what you do, it happens anyway.
words.example: We still played the game despite the cold weather.

words.definition: A dinosaur is a very big animal that lived millions of years ago.
words.example: I like to see the dinosaur bones at the museum.

words.definition: An exhibit is a display of interesting things.
words.example: There was an animal exhibit at the fair.

words.definition: Fame is reputation one has gained among the public.
words.example: He had fame and fortune, but he was not happy.

words.definition: A forecast is a idea of what the weather will be like in the future.
words.example: The forecast says that it will rain all day.

words.definition: A genius is a very smart person.
words.example: Edith is a genius of math.

words.definition: Someone who is gentle is kind and patient.
words.example: He is very gentle with the baby.

words.definition: Geography is the study of where things are on Earth.
words.example: I had to learn the names of all the states in geography class.

words.definition: To interfere is to get in the way of something that is happening.
words.example: I wish my mother would not interfere in my life.

words.definition: To do something lightly is to not use much force.
words.example: She touched his shoulder lightly.

words.definition: A principal is a person who is in charge of a school.
words.example: My school’s principal is very strict.

words.definition: A row is a line of things.
words.example: James sit in the first row of the class.

words.definition: A shelf is a place on a wall where you put things.
words.example: I keep my books on a shelf.

words.definition: If you do something out of spite, you want to be mean.
words.example: He broke my toy out of spite.

words.definition: Super means very good.
words.example: I had a super time at the party.

words.definition: If something is wet, it has water on it.
words.example: Since my shirt was wet, I had to change it.
